title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, designed to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to input their daily sleep hours and target sleep goals, providing a clear representation of their accumulated sleep debt or surplus. This repository serves as a practical TypeScript project showcasing front-end development techniques and sleep management concepts.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Python, designed as a project to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet system. It provides a user-friendly dashboard to monitor robot status, sensor readings, and other relevant information, enabling efficient control and monitoring of robotic fleets. The project focuses on creating an intuitive and informative display for managing and understanding complex robotic systems.

title: devboard
description: DevBoard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a development dashboard or personal portfolio. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, providing a robust and type-safe environment for showcasing projects and skills. The repository serves as a practical example of combining these technologies to build a modern, responsive web application.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using TeX for the primary document and potentially incorporating HTML for web-based presentation. It's a personal project showcasing my skills and experience, utilizing TeX for professional formatting and potentially HTML for online accessibility. This project serves as a dynamic and easily maintainable version of my resume.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project implementing a customizable and interactive event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a dynamic calendar solution for displaying and managing events, offering functionalities such as event creation, display, and potentially more interactive features. It serves as a practical demonstration of front-end development skills and calendar implementation using web technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a Next.js-based web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed for tracking IoT assets. Leveraging Supabase for backend functionalities and styled with Tailwind CSS, the project provides a user-friendly interface to monitor and manage the location and status of connected devices, showcasing a modern and efficient asset tracking solution.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example of building a dynamic user interface with a focus on best practices for Next.js development and UI design, demonstrating common dashboard features and data visualization techniques.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project exploring modern web development techniques using TypeScript and JavaScript. This repository serves as a platform to experiment with and implement various features and functionalities within a project-based learning environment, showcasing practical application of these languages and related concepts.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to facilitate collaborative brainstorming and project planning. Utilizing a dynamic board interface, users can easily visualize, organize, and prioritize ideas, fostering a more structured and engaging approach to project development. This project aims to provide a simple yet effective tool for managing ideas and tracking project progress.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks with Python code exploring various finance-related concepts and projects. It leverages Python's data analysis capabilities to analyze financial data, implement trading strategies, and visualize market trends. The project focuses on practical applications of Python in finance, providing a hands-on learning experience for those interested in quantitative finance and data-driven investment strategies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This project, built with HTML and Python, focuses on creating interactive map visualizations. It explores techniques for displaying and manipulating geographical data, providing a visual representation of spatial information. The repository showcases methods for integrating data with maps to highlight patterns and insights, and serves as a demonstration of map-based data visualization techniques.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed to demonstrate the creation of a full-stack web project. This repository showcases best practices in developing, deploying, and managing a complete web application, covering topics like database interaction, front-end design, and server-side logic.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, decentralized voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This project demonstrates a secure and transparent voting system, leveraging Next.js features for efficient rendering and API handling to create a seamless user experience. As a "project" repository, it serves as a practical example of implementing a voting platform with modern web technologies, showcasing best practices in frontend development and potential backend integrations.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a personal project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to explore interactive web development. This repository showcases a dynamic web application, focusing on practical application of front-end technologies and demonstrating a range of project-based skills. It's a playground for experimenting with modern web development techniques.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project facilitates debugging and understanding ROS-based systems by providing a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and interpret log data, ultimately streamlining the development and maintenance process.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Vite.js, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide an interactive and insightful project focused on [describe the app's main function based on README, e.g., AI-powered conversations, intelligent Q&A, etc.]. This project explores the integration of modern web technologies with AI capabilities.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router) and TypeScript, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a responsive and intuitive user interface. This project demonstrates a complete e-commerce flow, showcasing best practices in type safety, state management, and UI design, making it a valuable learning resource for developers interested in building modern web applications with these technologies.
